transcripts.text: One woman writes, I was raised in a family where women made it happen with or without a man. I can say without a chip on my shoulder that my son would 100% benefit from a positive male role model living with us to teach him things and spend time with him.  I do what I can, but it's not the same.  I would love for him to grow in a functional family home with positive experiences from both a man and a woman.  It would also be nice to have an adult to talk to at the end of the day.  someone to tackle problems with as a team.  i think it's healthy necessary and respectful to acknowledge the contribution a good man makes to a home.  women who are chameleons who say what men want to hear to trap them are only dangerous for the men naive enough to fall for it.  camouflage serves both offensive and defensive utilities in nature and the same is true for women.  when a woman becomes a single mother and her value falls she reaches into her bag of tricks without a concern for credibility and pulls out exactly what she needs to survive the defense of the chameleon's camouflage.  once he attracts some poor beta bucks into her web that defensive camouflage becomes offensive as she drains him of his life-force and his resources. If these types of women were genuine, they would have looked to positive female role models in their lives to model themselves after, and if they had none, they could look to the historical role of the family.  If they're stupid enough to believe their children don't need fathers, that they don't need anything more than the cock carousel while the babysitter watches her kids, and only change their perspective until after they've done permanent damage to their lives and the lives of their children, they were never worthy considerations for traditional motherhood anyways.
